alert.note: Alert for Howard (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 18 at 6:29PM CDT until May 18 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR EAST CENTRAL HOWARD COUNTY... At 629 PM CDT, rainfall estimates show between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.1 inches are possible in the warned area. Rainfall has largely ended, though some low water crossings may continue to see minor flooding over the next hour as the rain drains out. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Coahoma and Sand Springs. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
